articles.author: Nandita Bose, Andrea Shalal
articles.description: Donald Trump's aides scheduled a call between the president and Elon Musk after a huge public spat that saw threats fly over government contracts and included the world's richest man suggesting Trump should be impeached.
articles.title: Trump and Musk to speak on Friday after alliance descends into public feud

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russian drones attacked Ukraine's capital Kyiv early on Friday, triggering fires in residential buildings in different parts of the city, authorities said.
articles.title: Russian drones attack Kyiv, trigger fires in residential areas, officials say

articles.author: Mark Trevelyan, Tom Balmforth
articles.description: Russia will take years to replace nuclear-capable bomber planes that were hit in Ukrainian drone strikes last weekend, according to Western military aviation experts, straining a modernisation programme that is already delayed.
articles.title: Russia faces struggle to replace bombers lost in Ukrainian drone strikes

articles.author: Laurie Chen
articles.description: The scramble in recent weeks to secure export licences for rare earths shows China has devised a better, more precisely targeted weapon for trade war.
articles.title: China’s rare earth weapon changes contours of trade war battlefield

articles.author: Kirsty Needham
articles.description: China is taking further steps towards high seas boarding of fishing boats in the Pacific for the first time, risking tensions with Taiwanese fleets and U.S. Coast Guard vessels that ply the region, Pacific Islands officials told Reuters.
articles.title: China demonstrates coast guard capability to Pacific nations, step towards high seas patrols

articles.author: Nandita Bose, Andrea Shalal
articles.description: Trump also asserted that Musk's blistering attacks on the bill were motivated by the proposed elimination of consumer tax credits for electric vehicles.
articles.title: Trump attacks Musk as public feud escalates over tax-cut bill

articles.author: Mark Trevelyan
articles.description: Russia sees little chance of saving its last nuclear accord with the United States, due to expire in eight months, given the "ruined" state of relations with Washington, its top arms control official said in an interview published on Friday.
articles.title: Russia sees bleak prospects for expiring nuclear arms pact given 'ruined' ties with US

articles.author: Jessie Pang, James Pomfret
articles.description: Hong Kong authorities once again arrested prominent activist Joshua Wong on Friday and charged him with conspiracy to collude with a foreign country under a Beijing-imposed national security law.
articles.title: Hong Kong activist Joshua Wong faces second charge under national security law

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Tens of thousands of secondary school students sat for state exams in rebel-held eastern Congo this week, a complicated logistical feat requiring rare cooperation between the government and M23 rebels.
articles.title: Students in rebel-held eastern Congo brave insecurity to take exams

articles.author: Gopal Sharma
articles.description: Authorities in Nepal have charged former Prime Minister Madhav Kumar Nepal with corruption and demanded a million-dollar fine over the purchase of land by a firm owned by Indian yoga guru Baba Ramdev, a court official said on Friday.
articles.title: Nepal ex-PM faces graft charge over land deal with Indian yoga guru's firm
